title: Paris Hilton owns over 100 Juicy Couture sweatsuits in every colour
text:
The original Barbie-inspired Queen (Picture: Noam Galai/Getty Images for NYFW: The Shows)

Paris Hilton confessed she owns over 100 pairs of Juicy Couture sweatsuits ‘in every colour’.

The 38-year-old is known for her pink and sparkly looks, which often include rainbows, leopard prints and endless sequins.

But when she’s not becoming the centre of attention at every red carpet and celebrity party, she prefers to dress down.

Speaking to The Guardian, Paris said: ‘[M]y everyday wear is very comfortable. I love Juicy Couture’s velour tracksuits; I probably own 100 of them in every colour.

‘That’s my uniform when I’m chilling at home or going to the beach. Anything that doesn’t involve a red carpet.’

That doesn’t change the fact that when she goes all out, everyone’s heads will be turned.

‘Growing up, I always had my own sense of style,’ Paris said. ‘I loved being unique and original and coming up with my own trends.

This dress changed our lives (Picture: Dave Benett/Getty Images)

‘I love the way Kate Moss and Victoria Beckham dress – they always look so chic and stylish.’

The Simple Life star has always been a trend setter.

Does everyone remember the iconic 21st birthday dress that Kendall Jenner also wore over a decade later?

She said: ‘When I go to a party, I love to be glamorous and go all out; I like to sparkle and feel amazing.

‘I do have a signature look – I love pink and I love sparkles.’

Paris has been slaying her Halloween looks this year by embodying sexy versions of normal costumes.

One down, 99 to go (Picture: Arnaldo Magnani/Getty Images)

Sexy glittery sailors and schoolgirls seems to be her most popular choices this year.

The star admitted that her style has developed thanks to her sister Nicky Hilton.

‘I have been really influenced by my sister Nicky, whose style has always been the complete opposite of mine,’ the singer-DJ said. ‘I’ve learned to tone it down a little bit, be a little bit more understated sometimes.

‘It depends on the situation; I’m a chameleon. I can show up in a Chanel suit, looking like a businesswoman, but if I’m at a party or Halloween or Burning Man, then I’m going all out.’
